qas.question: How were East Prussians able to pay for land improvements and road construction?
What was the name of the initiative to help with the new projects in East Prussia?
What did Koch report to Hitler in 1933?

answers.text: that unemployment had been banished entirely

qas.question: On what date did R. Walther Darre become the Reich Peasant Leader?
On what date were Koch's "Land" representative arrested?
How much unemployment was there throughout the Reich?

context: Through <a0_0>publicly funded emergency relief programs<a0_0/> concentrating on agricultural land-improvement projects and road construction, the "<a1_0>Erich Koch Plan<a1_0/>" for East Prussia allegedly made the province <b7_0>free of unemployment<b7_0/>; on <b3_0><b5_0>August 16, 1933<b5_0/><b3_0/> Koch reported to Hitler <a2_0>that unemployment had been banished entirely<a2_0/> from East Prussia, a feat that gained admiration throughout the Reich. Koch's industrialization plans led him into conflict with R. Walther Darré, who held the office of the Reich Peasant Leader (Reichsbauernführer) and <b6_0>Minister of Agriculture<b6_0/>. Darré, a <b4_0>neopaganist<b4_0/> rural romantic, wanted to enforce his vision of an agricultural East Prussia. When his "Land" representatives challenged Koch's plans, Koch had them arrested.
